comment: I took 2 classes with Prof. Lee despite the not-great reviews on this site, and I'm glad that I did. While his accent made it hard to follow him in the first class, by the second class I was able to understand 90-95% of what he said. His DS&A class was REALLY good. I learned a lot that will carry forward into other classes.

Professor Lee is a solid Professor. He was always available for any questions I had during the semester and would give very in-depth explanations when struggling. Was very knowledgeable in the field and I wish I would have been able to take more classes with him. You will need to study and practice however if you want a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: Lectures are decent and he sounds like a nice person, but hw is unrelated. Exams are insane and webcam monitored for writing programs! In real world no one memorizes code. He also does write his own reviews on here due to high number of complaints. Be cautious when taking him. Seems nice but gets bad through semester. Very toxic professor.

I've taken CS5000 with Dr. Lee. He is extremely approachable and the class is extremely do-able, however you will have to study and I'd recommending using all resources available and I'd recommend trying a few of the programs on your own as well.

Making a career change and this being one of the first courses reqiured, I had anxiety coming into this class after reading all these reviews. This class is definetly doable, watch the lectures, understand the topics, do practice questions, watch youtube videos. Remember that it is an upper level course, so you must actually learn the material.

The last review about "weeding students out" literally sounds like it was written by Dr. Lee. Grad school is NOT the place for weeding out students, that's what undergrad was for! He was MEAN to the class. Threatening emails, minimizing students struggling, etc. Sucks that he teaches a gateway course! You are better off doing an online bootcamp.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Lee is teaching a course to weed out students that aren't likely to have success in the Master's program. Because of this, he gets a lot of hate. The "fake review" claims on here are laughable. I rated him high last semester for CS5000, and I'm going to rate him high again. Dr. Lee is clear in his lectures, and quickly responds to questions

A lot complained about him to department which is when the fake good reviews started popping up. Don't believe the good reviews, they are fake! I assure you all of the students in this class have issues with him. If you already know Java you'll be decent (don't expect A though). If it's first time in Java, you'll probably fail. Just being honest.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He knows what he's talking about, but good luck asking him to explain it to you. Make sure you pay attention to lectures and take notes. Unfortunately the info in your textbook won't be on the test. Don't point  out his errors on test or quizzes  unless you want a angry email back. He is the only teacher available so he can't be fired.

Incredibly intelligent and knows his stuff. However, exams are DIFFICULT & deviate a lot from the homework /lectures. IDE not allowed on exam which makes zero sense. If you study and have Java experience, you can get a C or B with "some effort". If no previous experience, you will work your butt off for a D or C. His emails can be threatening too.

Dr. Lee is a great professor. I took the online section, and you can either watch the in-person lectures live, or watch them later after they are recorded. The lectures/slides contain all the info you need to succeed on hw and the midterm, final, and quizzes. And Dr. Lee is very accessible and promptly answers emails. Would recommend.

Dr. Lee is incredibly smart, and he goes into greater depth than I expected for a foundational course. I ended up learning a lot more than I expected. I think people will complain about the difficulty of his tests, but this program is designed to catch you up to people with a 4 year CS degree. I highly recommend practicing for the exams in an IDE.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The guy knows what he's talking about, but his accent makes it hard to understand him. Everyone without previous experience failed the midterm. It had questions that had accidental errors, this changed nothing. No IDEs are allowed for the tests, it's scratch paper only. If you're not familiar with programming or Java, PLEASE don't take this class.

Homework in no prepared student for difficulty of tests. Tests were not in a real IDE which is not realistic. Tests contained errors both in content and java syntax, interesting as he gave us no grace on errors yet his tests contained syntax errors.Sent 2 hostile emails to the entire class berating us for not doing well. Test averages below 50.

I really like Professor Lee. He is very responsive to questions during class and via email, and you can tell he cares about his students' success. The homework, exams, and quizzes are very achievable, and his expectations are clear. I would take him again.

Dr. Lee is a nice man and knows what he's talking about. However, as of recent, he is taking out his anger on students due to having been dropped from the tenure track. Maybe he will change, but rn, you should avoid him. He just doesn't care how many people fail, and the materials don't line up at all. Only those with previous programming passed.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Lee is a great human being. I learned a lot in his class, and it was really a pleasure to have him as my teacher. Since this is a foundational course, it should be an easy A. If you got anything else, I would recommend looking in the mirror as to why your grade is the way it is.

Very sad to see how bad Dr. Lee has become. When he first got here some years ago, he was amazing. Not sure what happened along the way, but he is absolutely TERRIBLE now. Please, do NOT take him! He is unnecessarily rude, unclear, and a hard grader. Test questions make no sense, and his homework is too much. PLEASE, avoid him!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: You are highly likely to fail if you take him. Because i did, i retook someone else and got an A. His assignment are weekly and incredibly hard for no reason.

Only have him for CS 5000, so this is only for that class. He's very "lazy" in the sense that none of the materials are his own. He uses other people's powerpoints, HWs, quizzes and tests. This makes the class very difficult as all the materials say/ask for different thing. Unwilling to modify the materials so that they are all cohesive. Avoid!

Wow did this man send mean emails. Many students were struggling were the pandemic (family members dying,no money to retake course if they failed it etc) and he said "not my problem. you should have figured it out". Like yeah, let me figure out un-losing my job to pay to retake this course. Notes had no connection to tests or hw. Avoid for CS 5000!

He was a really nice guy, but he just was not a good teacher for CS 5000. It is an intro class meant for people who are new to programming, but taught it as if we had CS undergrad degrees. He was awful about telling us quiz & test dates. He'd randomly send an email saying we had one in a few days & we had no time to prepare. Many got low grades.

He always used other people's materials, meaning that PowerPoints, assignments, quizzes, & tests all said & asked for different things. No connection between any of them Assignments were SO hard. I got F's on a lot of them. English is his 2nd language, so the phrasing in his emails can sometimes be harsh and/or not make sense. Buy the textbook!

He's good for CS 5040, but NOT for CS 5000. Very nice guy, but bad fit for this class. He required webcam monitoring for the tests and it had free response, meaning that he wanted you to write entire programs FROM MEMORY. Very unrealistic. Test averages were below 50. He curved overall grades about 5 points at the end, but still lots of bad grades.

Very clear instruction on algorithm logic, pseudocode and specific coding implementation. Dr. Lee also explains the math behind the efficiency evaluations. He is also very accessible outside of class for questions and explanations, even if those topics are not directly addressed in class. I think he really wants students to learn the materials.

Only issue so far is he is unclear about tests & quizzes. Syllabus says there are 3 quizzes & 2 tests (midterm & final). 6 weeks in, we hadn't had a single quiz nor was there any mention of the test. Then suddenly he emails "Quiz 1 & test 1 next week.". For that reason, you must keep up with up all the notes. Other than that, he's solid.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Classes don't get easier than this one. Tests and homework assignments were easy. Lectures are clear and easy to understand.

One of the best professors Ive ever had. If you do what he requires you to do, you will get an easy A. With no prior CS background, this class was a good introduction and helped me to find my interest. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He also gives detailed answers to every question. I would HIGHLY recommend taking him

He is a very nice individual, but he could not explain things clearly. I felt like he didn't understand the material; form what he was saying. when we had questions, he responded with "um"s, then give an answer that does not answer the initial question. His lecturing style is based on power-points that he reads monotonous tone. He was not engaging.
